October 1?, 1952
Professor Thomas A* Rousse
Chairman, Speech Department
The University of Texas
Austin, Texas
Dear Toms
We are beating the bushes ferociously to secure a
replacement of Jim Miles as Executive Director of the Na¬
tional Association of Educational Broadcasters* One of the
people whom v© are considering at this point is Gail Adkins.
I shall appreciate from you a confidential but detailed •
evaluation of Gail and your estimate of his possible effec¬
tiveness on this job*
'The Executive Director of NAEB must be a person
with real organizational ability, a man capable of holding
his own with rational organizations and people in strategic
government arid education circles: he must have imagination,
tact, and ambition and must be a real leader* In replacing
Jim we hope to secure a man who will stay with us a mdnimuia
of fbur years and this person must not only represent us
well with all groups on a national level but must carry the
responsibility of welding and developing a strong national
organisation of MAEB* We have been looking for a man in
the ten to twelve thousand dollar class but have not found
him. If we should employ someone on Oail,s level, we would
expect to start him at sever* or eight thousand dollars and
raise him on up as his growth merits*
You can understand that we should like to request
this information kept, confidential and I assure you your
reply will be treated with the same courtesy*
My kindest personal regards*
Sincerely yours,
